about.content: L-Systems or Lindenmayer system were developed by a hungarian biologist Aristid Lindenmayer in 1968, while working on modeling plant development. His work was inspired by the need of describing plant growth processes based on formal gramathics, which at the time were only used in computer systems and in learning languages. Lindenmayer noticed that iterative structures could be used to model plant biological development.
about.content2: Sistēmas darbības princips nozīmē aizvietot sākuma stāvoklī esošos simbolus ar to, kas ir noteikts noteikumos, piemēram, ja sākuma stāvoklis ir F un notiekums ir F = FF, tad katrā izpildes ciklā simbols F tiks aizvietots ar FF. Pēc noteikumu izpildes veidojas simbolu virne, kura reprezentē zīmēšanas darbības.
about.content3: Sistēmu vizualizācijai parasti izmanto “Turtle graphics” zīmēšanas metodi, kurā, pārvietojoties no vienas koordinātes uz citu, tiek uzzīmēta līnija. Šai zīmēšanas metodei ir divi stāvokļi – pārvietoties zīmējot un pārvietoties.
credits.content: This section contains information about literature, tutorials and tools used in the development of this app.
credits.content2: Tutorial that was used in development of this app. It describes what is L-Systems and goes over, step by step on how to code a visualizer for L-systems using Javascript.
